comments.author: M. @ V. Gourmet
comments.content: I love how simple and still surprisingly flavorful/unconventional this dish looks. I'm not a huge zucchini fan, but I bet the basic idea works for almost any vegetable. I've got some leftover cauliflower in the fridge -- I think I'll try this recipe out on it for dinner tonight!

comments.author: Kalyn
comments.content: Very interesting way to cook zucchini.  When I first saw your photo I thought the breadcrumbs were Sumac, which I think would taste fantastic on this!

comments.author: cole
comments.content: Sounds amazing! I'm collecting summer veggie recipes on my site - stop by and link up your faves! http://coleskitch.blogspot.com/2011/07/favorite-summer-veggie-recipe.html

comments.author: ben
comments.content: what great flavor! i'll certainly make this many more times. Enjoyed by all. thanks! easy to make too!

comments.author: shuchi
comments.content:
Hi Michael ,
Lovely blog !
I love zucchini ... great way to cook it! I am going to try this soon ! Thanks for sharing this :)

comments.author: Susan
comments.content: Fantastic.  7-year-old leaped to get the leftovers.  She had feta, and we had blue cheese on top--not traditional, but delicious!  Served with lemony white beans.  Thanks again for another great meal!
